title: Inuktitut Brackets are not recognized

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: [Playground link](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=0a009d396cb891704dbd8f2bd8aa78a2)


```rust
struct genericᐸTᐳ(T);
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0412]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0412): cannot find type `T` in this scope
 [--> src/main.rs:2:19
](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=0a009d396cb891704dbd8f2bd8aa78a2#)  |
2 | struct genericᐸTᐳ(T);
  |                  -^ not found in this scope
  |                  |
  |                  help: you might be missing a type parameter: `<T>`
```

Ideally the output should look something like:

```
error: unknown start of token: \u{37e}
  --> src/wasm_jumploader/host_functions.rs:24:64
   |
24 |                 println!("SYSCALL: {} + {} = {}", a, b, result);
   |                                                                ^
   |
help: Unicode character ';' (Greek Question Mark) looks like ';' (Semicolon), but it is not
   |
24 |                 println!("SYSCALL: {} + {} = {}", a, b, result);
   |       
```
